comments.raw_text:
When I receive a vCard from an Outlook sender, the picture (logo) present into the vCard is not displayed by Thunderbird.
If I save this vCard on the desktop and then try to import it (with the new functionality of Thunderbird 5), the picture doesn't appear too.

Step to reproduce:
- try to send yourself a vcard with an image (or use the one available in attachment).
- click on the icon to open the contact informations.
- Thunderbird will display all the contact's informations excepted the picture.
comments.text:
Created attachment 539508
vcard with a picture inside to reproduce the bug

When I receive a vCard from an Outlook sender, the picture (logo) present into the vCard is not displayed by Thunderbird.
If I save this vCard on the desktop and then try to import it (with the new functionality of Thunderbird 5), the picture doesn't appear too.

Step to reproduce:
- try to send yourself a vcard with an image (or use the one available in attachment).
- click on the icon to open the contact informations.
- Thunderbird will display all the contact's informations excepted the picture.

comments.text: Same problem exists on linux x86-64 platform, looks like regression was introduced recently, because with TB 3.1 images were importing.

comments.author: el.cameleon.1@gmail.com
comments.creator: el.cameleon.1@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to spamerx from comment #1)
> Same problem exists on linux x86-64 platform, looks like regression was
> introduced recently, because with TB 3.1 images were importing.

In TB3.1, you were not able to import vCard file, so this is certainly not a regression ;-)

vCard import came in TB9, and was tracked in bug 646638
comments.text:

In TB3.1, you were not able to import vCard file, so this is certainly not a regression ;-)

comments.creator: romain2boss@yahoo.fr
comments.text:
Reproduced with Thunderbird 78.6.0 (32 bits):
- The picture in vCard file attached to this ticket is not displayed in Photo tab when opening the file with Thunderbird.
- The picture seems well encoded according to http://jaredwinick.github.io/base64-image-viewer/ tool
- The PHOTO field seems ok according to vCard format 2.1 as can be seen in https://web.archive.org/web/20120501162958/http://www.imc.org/pdi/vcard-21.doc section 2.2.3
comments.raw_text:
Reproduced with Thunderbird 78.6.0 (32 bits):
- The picture in vCard file attached to this ticket is not displayed in Photo tab when opening the file with Thunderbird.
- The picture seems well encoded according to http://jaredwinick.github.io/base64-image-viewer/ tool
- The PHOTO field seems ok according to vCard format 2.1 as can be seen in https://web.archive.org/web/20120501162958/http://www.imc.org/pdi/vcard-21.doc section 2.2.3
